answers.answer: Hello.  I'm not a medical professional, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  For a fasting blood sugar, that is high.  It is possible that Lupus can affect blood sugars, because any stress that a body has can increase blood sugar levels, but unless there was something different than normal going on, it's not likely.  With your family history, you probably want to continue on the path to a diabetes diagnosis.  Good luck

question: My question is; I was diagnosed with Systemic Lupus early last year. Could Lupus effect ones blood sugar level? Also, diabetes is very promenant in my family, on my mother's side.Thank you,Ms. Johnson
title: Blood sugar was 148 during fasting
